intro: Kraenzlinorchis mandersii, commonly known as the Mander's orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodland habitats and thrives in cool, humid conditions. Kraenzlinorchis mandersii has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces flowers that are usually arranged in a loose raceme. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its native range.
